summary: If the VA denies a veteran's benefit request, the veteran can bring the case to the Board of Veterans' Appeals. Congress has raised questions about the quality of the Board's decisions. We testified that as the Board faces large workloads and time pressure, quality assurance activities such as case reviews and decision monitoring are key tools for minimizing rework. But the Board could better use...
title: VA Disability Benefits: Board of Veterans' Appeals Should Address Gaps in Its Quality Assurance Process
